p: The Fifth Assessment Report of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climat e Change (IPCC - AR5) concluded that, globally, rising temperatures and changing rainfall patterns were linked to a range of health outcomes ( IPCC 2014). Climate change-related alterations in weather and climate patterns would affect many determinants of health (e.g., thermal stress, floods, storms, droughts, bushfires, and food and water quality and quantity), and the geographic range and activity of infectious diseases.
